summary: This document is an email chain from March 2021 among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding a woman who called identifying herself as a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss coordinating outreach to her for screening and a potential interview, noting her prior representation by an attorney who had been uncooperative.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the perpetrator by a woman who called the U.S. Attorney's Office claiming to be a former victim.

persons.name: ands
persons.context: Mentioned as having been contacted by the caller again; part of the internal coordination.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.role: Assistant U.S. Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the initial email forwarding the victim call information, providing context about prior uncooperative attorney interactions, and requesting FBI screening.

connections.description: Collaborating on the response to a potential victim's call, as shown in the email chain.
The caller identified herself as a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Victim Call to U.S. Attorney's Office
events.description: A woman called the U.S. Attorney's Office, identified herself as a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein, and provided her contact information.

events.title: Prior Attorney Contact
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office was in contact with an attorney (Mr. [redacted]) who claimed to represent at least nine Epstein victims unwilling to speak, but he became unresponsive.

keyFacts: A woman contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office in February 2021 claiming to be a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein and seeking to provide information.
The woman stated she had been represented by an attorney for the Victim Fund but was not currently represented, and had previously contacted an NYPD detective.
Prosecutors noted prior difficulties in 2020 with an attorney who claimed to represent multiple Epstein victims but was uncooperative and unresponsive.
The email chain shows internal coordination to have the FBI conduct an initial screening of the potential victim.
The document indicates ongoing investigative efforts by the Southern District of New York regarding Epstein victims in 2021.
